Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan must win against Canada to have any chance of making it to the next stage of the T20 World Cup.
A loss will make Pakistan's final Group A game against Ireland a mere formality.
Pakistan's assistant coach Azhar Mahmood said Pakistan's batters were guilty of poor shot selection and decision-making during the chase against India.
Azhar Mahmood termed the match against Canada as a 'do-or-die match'.
Aaron Johnson, a top-order batter for Canada, said the unpredictable nature of the pitch in New York may work in his team’s favour.
Canada go into the match with a win over Ireland in the bag and are 'fancying their chances' against Pakistan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch in New York continues to invite discussions and criticism from fans and experts, but it has steadily improved since hosting its first match on June 2.
Cloudy and humid weather is forecast in Long Island on Tuesday, which should allow a full game without any disruptions.
Pakistan and Canada’s only T20 meeting came in 2008 when Pakistan won the match by 35 runs.
Both sides have not won many T20 matches in the recent past, but meet each other on the back of contrasting results.
Pakistan's two losses in two games have put the spotlight on their misfiring batting, while Canada’s spirits will be lifted with their win over Ireland.
Others: Pakistan could try and bring in young opener Saim Ayub and drop one of their three spin-bowling all-rounders for another pace bowler in the form of Abbas Afridi.
Canada are likely to stick with the team that brought them their first-ever T20 World Cup win.
